intro: Acourtia hooveri, commonly known as Hoover's acourtia, is a rare flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, grass-like leaves. This species thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Acourtia hooveri is typically found in California and Nevada, growing in open habitats such as hillsides and plains. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a sensitive species.
